page.title: 18FARMING AROUND OAKHAM
page.content:
The land in our sector is half pasture and half arable. Oil seed rape, wheat and barley are at present all being grown. Most of the pasture land is on the hillsides, this is because the land is much poorer and more difficult to cultivate here.
The pastue land is used by the farmers for grazing their cattle and sheep. Most of the farms are about forty acres in size. Some of the grass will be used for silage and making hay.
Even today on the pasture land it i till possible to be able to see the old three_feild system. However many of the hedges that were built around the enclosed land are now in the process of being pulled down.
